course.name: Dictionary (Using Python)
course.short_description: Dictionary ko thoda depth mein samajhte hain.

content.value: To create a dictionary we put in the key value pairs in a comma separated form inside curly brackets { } and use the colon ":" to assign values to keys`.
Keys Case Sensitive :-
Dictionary keys should be case sensitive, means we can write keys with same names but different case. Python treats them as different keys.
// KeyError tab aati hai jab key dictionay mai nahi hoti hai.
In the dictionary, dict , ball a key which has value "green", similarly "Ball" is another key which has value "red".
You can create a dictionary using the dict() function.
{'age': 20, 'name': 'Ravina'}
DataType of Keys and Values
A "dictionary" can have values of any data type and can also be same, but keys are always to be unique.
Nested Dictionary :-
{1: 'NAVGURUKUL', 2: 'IN', 3: {'A': 'WELCOME', 'B': 'To', 'C': 'DHARAMSALA'}}
Accessing Elements from a Dictionary:-
We can access dictionary values with the use of square brackets. Look at the example below to understand.
organisation male 20
get() :-
We can also make use of the get() function to access dictionary values.
In a python dictionary we can add only one key value pair at a time. To add to a dictionary we mention the key inside square brackets "[ ]" and use the equal to "=" operator to assign a value.
{'Name': 'RAM', 'Age': 17,'ORGANIZATION': 'NAVGURUKUL', 'place':'dharamsala}
{'Name': 'RAM', 'Age': 17, 'student': {'id': 22, 'place': 'dharamsala'}}
Key Exists or not
We use the in keyword to check whether a given key exists or not in a dictionary.

car ={
 "brand": "ford",
 "model": "mustang",
 "year": 1964
}
if "model" in car:
 print("Yes, 'model' is one of the keys in the car dictionary.")

else:
 print("No, 'model' key dictionary mai nahi hai.")
Yes, 'model' is one of the keys in the this dict dictionary.
Updating Dictionary :-
To update dictionary ,we can make an entry in it or we can add a key-value pair or we can change the value of an existing key. As given in the example explained:-
{'1': 'RAM', '2': 17,'3':'male'}
{'Name': 'RAM', 'Age': 17, 'student': {'id': 35, 'place': 'dharamsala'}}
We can copy a dictionary in two ways,first method is using copy() and second method by using built-in function dict().
{'room2': '7th', 'room3': '8th', 'room1': '6th'}

We can remove dictionary elements by many methods.
Like given below.
pop() :-
Using the pop( ) method we can remove a specified element from the dictionary.
{'brand': 'Ford', 'year': 1964}
popitem():-
The popitem() method removes the last inserted item:
{'name':'jack','id':22}
del :-
Using the del keyword we can remove a specified element from the dictionary.
{'name':'jack','id':22}
Gujarat Maharashtra Rajasthan Bihar
Gandhinagar<br> Mumbai<br> Jaipur<br> Patna
17<br>Bijender<br>10th<br>
How to print keys and values together from a dictionary?
('rating', 7.5)<br>('hero', 'Vijay')<br>('name', 'Puli')<br>
We use Dictionary length to find the number of items/key value pairs in a dictionary.
3
Now we will do some questions related to dictionary. Which will help us in better understanding of the it.
Write a program such that the below given dictionaries are into a single dictionary and add the values having same key.
Write a program to print 'exists' if entered key already exists in the dictionary and print 'not exists' if the entered key does not exist.
If input is “name” then output will be “exist”
If input is “class” then output will be “not exists”.
Ek program likhiye jo ki dictionaries ki values ka sum print kare.
Write a program remove the first key value pair from a nested dictionary.
Create a dictionary from 2 lists, where the elements of 1st list are the keys and the elements of the 2nd list are the corresponding values.
Write a program to remove duplicate keys.
Take a list having dictionary elements as shown below (Sample Data) and then store all the unique values into a list and print.
Take input of name and marks of 10 students and store to a dictionary.
Store the unique letters and their frequency of the letters from the word "MISSISSIPPI" to a dictionary, were the letters are the keys and their frequencies are the values.
Count the total number of items from the values of the dictionary which are in the form of a list.
Write a program to print the top 3 highest values of a given dictionary.
Write a program to create a dictionary with all numbers from 1 to 15 as the keys and their squares as the corresponding values.
Write a program to print the top 3 highest values of a given dictionary.
Write a program to sort a dictionary in ascending or descending according to its values .
Now we will do some questions related to the dictionary, which will help us in better understanding of it.

In this task, you have to learn six new concepts about the dictionary.
Firstly, you have to read the three new concepts of the dictionary from Python's website.
Then you have to read three new concepts from stackoverflow.
You will share your understanding on a Google doc and share it with your mentor and do some questions related to concepts.
You will take a class in which you will explain the new concepts you have learned.
Q1. Difference between dict.items() and dict.iteritems() in Python?
Q2. Write a Python program to print the dictionary in a table format?
Q3. How to find length of dictionary values?
Q4. Find keys with duplicate values in the dictionary?
Q5. Sum list of dictionaries with the same key?
Q6. Split dictionary keys and values into separate lists?
Q7. Convert a set into a dictionary?
Q8. Get key with maximum value in dictionary?
Q9. Sort the list alphabetically in a dictionary?
Q10. Remove spaces from dictionary keys?
Please fill this quiz with proper details to understand how much of this course did you understand.
